messageBody:
Bob Koss wrote:

> On 2/7/03 12:34 AM, "Curt Sampson" <yahoo_sucks@...> wrote:
>
>> On Thu, 6 Feb 2003, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>>
>>> Pushing every SQL statement you use out to a ResourceBundle (or other
>>> metadata file) is a good idea.
>>
>> Eww! I know this tends to be a bit of a personal preference, but I far
>> prefer to keep my code together when I can. If a statement is used in
>> only one place, keeping it where it's used makes the code much easier to
>> read, because you don't have to go chasing off into some other file to
>> find out what SQL statement is being executed.
>>
>
> That's probably true if the SQL never has to change. If the schema
> changes, I find it more convenient to go to one known place instead of
> having to search my entire app for possible changes.
>

Very true.

Additionally, you can handle the file to your DB admin and tell him 'You
can mess with the joins etc. as much as you want, as long you don't mix the
question marks after the WHILE and the column names before the FROM'. More
than once saved me a lot of work.
--
